summary:
A prompt for the Jonsa community:
Davos is Sansa’s Hand (because wtf is he doing in KL) and eventually he grows so tired of the...
body:
A prompt for the Jonsa community:

Davos is Sansa’s Hand (because wtf is he doing in KL) and eventually he grows so tired of the army of suitors that send ravens almost every fuckin’ day asking for the Queen in the North’s hand in marriage that he goes to the Wall and steal Jon himself to bring him back to Winterfell to put an end to all of this nonsense.

tags: this is utter shit i apologize i just needed to write SOMETHING tonight
summary: I don't know if you're still accepting these but theonsa+ karaoke night/date
question: I don't know if you're still accepting these but theonsa+ karaoke night/date
answer:
It’s the worst night of the year.

Karaoke night.

A tradition as old as… well, Bran. For years the Starks have a standing invitation at the Winterfell Karaoke Bar on the last Friday in May. When they were kids, they’d stay near the stage, Ned and Cat standing guard, as they took turns belting out classic songs. Sometimes they were emotional - Theon’s favorite was Robb’s horribly out of tune rendition of Hey There Delilah that preceded his proposal to Margaery a few years back - and other times…

There was a strict social media ban for a reason.

No, these performances had to be witnessed live. If you missed one, you were shit out of luck.

So, naturally, Theon had only ever missed two karaoke nights - one, night his father died; and two, last year. 

“Are you and Sansa going to do your duet this year?” Robb leans back in his chair, arm resting across the back of his wife’s. Arya’s just finished her solo - Like a Prayer - and Gendry cheers on his other side. “We were all kind of sad neither of you were here last time.”

Theon glances sideways, eyes flickering briefly behind him to bright red hair and a wide smile. He shrugs. “We hadn’t talked about it but I don’t see why not.”

He still remembers their duet - when Theon was 15 and Sansa 13, and Sansa had tricked him into singing the Backstreet Boys. Once he had heard the first strains of the song he had unfortunately memorized, Theon decided the only way to get through the experience would be to perform in the most ridiculous fashion - crazy dance moves, off-pitch singing, and exaggerated emotions. 

Sansa, of course, responded in kind.

And a tradition was born.

Robb narrows his eyes slightly. “She didn’t talk to you about it already?”

Theon shakes his head, looking forward at the stage. Sansa skips onto it, immediately picking her song on the machine. She’s shining. “Nah. It’s fine, we’ll wing it.”

And then Sansa presses play. And looks straight at Theon. “You joining me or not?” she says into her mic.

And Theon can’t help but grin. He knows Robb is watching him with suspicion, but Sansa beams at him as he quickly climbs to the stage.

Just in time:

“Listen baby…. ain’t no mountain high, ain’t no valley low…”

The song isn’t any different than what they’d usually pick - a love song, something fun and slightly upbeat. But this year, Theon doesn’t over-exaggerate his movements and he doesn’t purposefully sing off tune. This year… he sings. It’s not great, but it’s not bad and Sansa is visibly surprised.

But she’s smiling.

Especially when:

“If you need me, call me, no matter where you are…”

Sansa Stark is an angel most of the time, a devil when it matters - like when she plots revenge for one of Arya’s pranks, or when she attends Rickon’s parent-teacher conferences, or when they’re in bed and she’s moaning into his sheets - but in that moment, she’s just ethereal: laughing her lyrics, swaying closer to him, eyes soft. 

They play to audience during the chorus, but Theon turns to sing to Sansa during the next verse. Because the lyrics are too good - she’s brilliant, picking this song, like she can read his thoughts and maybe she can - and she’s dancing like everyone is watching. When they start singing overlapping harmonies, he spins her and she almost misses her line, nudging him playfully with her shoulder. 

He wants to kiss her.

As the song fades, and they’re out of breath and facing each other, the audience clapping and whooping and cheering…

“Fuck it.”

Theon kisses his girlfriend and Sansa kisses him back.

(Later:

“When were you planning on tell me, mate?”

“Before the wedding, at least.”

“You’re lucky you’re pretty, Greyjoy.”)

(Last year:

“You need to stop kissing me if we’re gonna make it to karaoke, Theon.”

“I’ve waited almost ten years to kiss you. I’m not going to stop now.”

“That’s… oh, yes… fair.”)

No, these performances had to be witnessed live. If you missed one, you were shit out of luck.

So, naturally, Theon had only ever missed two karaoke nights - one, night his father died; and two, last year. 

“Are you and Sansa going to do your duet this year?” Robb leans back in his chair, arm resting across the back of his wife’s. Arya’s just finished her solo - Like a Prayer - and Gendry cheers on his other side. “We were all kind of sad neither of you were here last time.”

Theon glances sideways, eyes flickering briefly behind him to bright red hair and a wide smile. He shrugs. “We hadn’t talked about it but I don’t see why not.”

He still remembers their duet - when Theon was 15 and Sansa 13, and Sansa had tricked him into singing the Backstreet Boys. Once he had heard the first strains of the song he had unfortunately memorized, Theon decided the only way to get through the experience would be to perform in the most ridiculous fashion - crazy dance moves, off-pitch singing, and exaggerated emotions.

blog.name: ao3feed-sansaery
blog.title: A Sansaery Ao3feed
blog.description: I want very much for you to be happy, Sansa

title: The waves between us
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2MiNXzn

by LOVECLVBS

The feud between the Lannisters and the Starks has been going on for centuries. Nobody really knows what happened between them only knowing it would probably never end. But their feud even expanded to their respective football teams, winterfell vs kingslanding. However, the feud momentarily stops when Joffrey Lannister gets sent away. Until he comes back a year later demanding blood, wanting vengeance to those who wronged him: Robb Stark, Jon Snow and especially his half bastard brother, Gendry Waters.

Words: 941, Chapters: 1/40, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Game of Thrones (TV), A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin
  • Rating: Mature
  • Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence
  • Categories: F/F, F/M, M/M
  • Characters: Arya Stark, Gendry Waters, Sansa Stark, Margaery Tyrell, Robb Stark, Jon Snow, Theon Greyjoy, Rickon Stark, Bran Stark, Ygritte (ASoIaF), Samwell Tarly, Grenn (ASoIaF), Edd Tollett, tormund, Ned Dayne
  • Relationships: Arya Stark/Gendry Waters, Sansa Stark/Margaery Tyrell, Theon Greyjoy/Robb Stark, Jon Snow/Ygritte, Jojen Reed/Bran Stark
  • Additional Tags: Developing Relationship, Alternate Universe - College/University, Modern Setting, Modern game of thrones - gendrya, Basically brother’s roommate/best friend trope, Angst, Lannister and Stark Rivalries, Jealous!Gendry, Soft!Badass! Arya, Sexual Content


read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2MiNXzn

by LOVECLVBS

The feud between the Lannisters and the Starks has been going on for centuries. Nobody really knows what happened between them only knowing it would probably never end. But their feud even expanded to their respective football teams, winterfell vs kingslanding. However, the feud momentarily stops when Joffrey Lannister gets sent away. Until he comes back a year later demanding blood, wanting vengeance to those who wronged him: Robb Stark, Jon Snow and especially his half bastard brother, Gendry Waters.

summary: Queen in the North From “little dove,” to taking back Winterfell, Sansa survived and learned, and led her people to...
caption:
Queen in the North

From “little dove,” to taking back Winterfell, Sansa survived and learned, and led her people to independence. Sansa witnessed Jon be named King in the North, but her coronation was more elegant and satisfying — crown, throne and all.  

Throughout the series, Sansa adopted the looks of the female leaders she looked up to. While this dress is entirely worthy of the Queen in the North, the strong women who inspired her also found their way into details of this dress.

Costume designer Michele Clapton created the dress with the same fabric for “dark Sansa” and the same fabric dye that was used for Margaery’s wedding dress, to represent their deep bond.

Clapton also pointed out that the wolves on the sleeve of the dress starts to turn into fish scales, to honor Sansa’s mother, Catelyn and House Tully. 

This detailing is also seen on Sansa’s crown.

summary: someone just said sansa stark is classist and not a relatable character because she’s white... (I didn’t realize privlege really...
body: someone just said sansa stark is classist and not a relatable character because she’s white… (I didn’t realize privlege really mattered anymore once you’ve been belittled, orphaned, beaten, and raped but?) yet dany is. dany, the woman who left essos in shambles after she got what she wanted (colonialism anyone?) and has used the unsullied and dothraki simply as weapons and pawns except for the very few that are close to her (missandei, grey worm, drogo) and simply shipped all the rest over to westeros without even a second thought of the culture shock they’d endure (let’s not forget she burned all the khals…. for their culture….). sansa grew up privileged, for sure, and she’s greedy, naïve, and selfish in the beginning. but after being nearly raped she tells shae “I would have given them bread if I had it” while we KNOW dany would have burned them. sansa “keep the gates open as long as possible” so all her people, of all classes, could be safe. sansa who did up a budget and rations on food so ALL could eat through winter whereas dany said “lol dragons eat what they want.” as well, dany demanded she be the queen of westeros without understanding the culture or the people or proving to them how great she’d be. she just thought she deserved it. so she burned a whole city, with most of the people inside its walls being innocent. i’m sorry, what?

blog.name: bighound-littlebird
blog.title: The SanSan Safe Haven
blog.description: We strive to make this a quality Sansan blog free of hate for book and show fans alike. Our goal is to provide inspiration and quality sansan art, fanfiction recommendations , edits, meta, discussion, confessions, head canons and prompts for you.♡ We tag NSFW content. Header gif by @kingsleigh

summary: (Same anon re: Sandor “woobification”) I haven’t read the books in full (yet!) but thank you for the insight! But I’ve also seen...
question: (Same anon re: Sandor “woobification”) I haven’t read the books in full (yet!) but thank you for the insight! But I’ve also seen excerpts that feature book!Sandor crying at least twice, while there is no crying from him in the show (right?). Would it be accurate to say he’s just overall more... stable(?) in the show? I think your definition of men showing emotions other than anger is pretty accurate, but I’d think book!Sandor crying would be more “wooby” than a more stable Sandor!
answer:
Excellent point about Sandor Clegane crying in the books. But I don’t neccesarily think he’s less stable for doing so. Crying is a very natural and healthy response to fear and pain, what is unhealthy is that he needs to be drunk/feverish/dying in order to do so.

No one “woobifies” Sandor Clegane more than GRRM. Over the course of ACOK, he spills his lifelong held secret to a young girl, cries, climbs into her bed for comfort and makes her sing him a song before asking her to run away with him.

But fandom has what we call “fanon”, which is a portrayal that becomes so common in fanfiction that often we forget whether it’s actually canon. And so rude, swearing, physically rough Sandor has made a strong impression in fan’s minds. And while show Sandor really isn’t any better (in many ways he’s worse imho), that isn’t the characterization that stands out to most book fans.

In reality, Sandor’s verbal and physical mistreatment of Sansa are greatly exaggerated, as is his cruelty in general, and primarily a result of drunkeness.

The same man, sober, also has done the following:

  • protected Sansa and Lady from Lannister soldiers and Illyn Payne
  • cheered on Tommen
  • made fun of Tyrion to make Joffrey laugh
  • wore a hideous dog sweater to impress the ladies
  • pets dogs
  • cares for his horse
  • insulted Boros in front of Sansa so she wouldn’t be afraid of him
  • covered her in his cloak - twice
  • covered Sansa’s lie to Joffrey to spare Dontos
  • gently dabbed the blood from her lip after she was struck by Meryn
  • wears jeweled pins
  • contradicted Joffrey in court by calling for an end to Sansa’s beating
  • rescued her from the mob
  • called for medical care for her injuries

All of which is why Sansa trusts him more than any of the others, saves his cloaks and uses his memory to comfort herself.
